User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:10.0a2) Gecko/20111115 Firefox/10.0a2
Build ID: 20111115042021

Steps to reproduce:

Upgraded Firefox from Aurora 9.0a2 to 10.0a2


Actual results:

Firefox no longer sets or uses the 'browser.taskbar.lastgroupid' pref, which I used to generate shortcuts that allowed me to use a portable Firefox installation without having duplicate icons in the taskbar. Checking the source for nsIWinTaskbar::GetAppUserModelId I see it now looks up the value in the registry, but has no provision to use a manual ID if the kets are not found.


Expected results:

There should be a command line argument, preference value or any other mean to manually choose the taskbar grouping ID that is not the registry. Firefox should at least revert to the default ID for the application (as read from application.ini like previously, e.g. 'Mozilla.Firefox.10.0a2') if nothing is found in the registry instead of leaving the grouping ID unset.
